attributes.action: Open doctors surgery’s to the general public again!
attributes.additional_details: The doctors are hard to get through on the phone to, my fiancé once had to call 394 times just to get through to an automated service! Also I know of many people who have not been able to see a doctor for important medical issues and have had to go to A&E to be seen by some form of doctor! Henceforth, this is why the NHS is overrun with patients, because doctors are not seeing people.
attributes.background: Make sure the doctors surgery’s are actually seeing patients instead of only doing phone calls.

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to GP appointments, including decisions on whether face-to-face appointments are appropriate, are operational matters for the NHS and individual GPs, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to create a legal right for patients to receive timely face-to-face GP appointments, if that's something you'd like to happen.
